column1: ¡Feliz Día de los Muertos! We celebrate and remember our family and friends who have departed. And especially during this difficult year we honor the loved ones who have passed away due to COVID-19. Here is our family's ofrenda. #DayoftheDead https://t.co/b1s9djaJMS

#TeamCisneros volunteers are geared up and ready to go this morning! You can join our #CA39 socially-distant contactless lit drops today through #ElectionDay. Sign up: https://t.co/AYVzKwt6YF https://t.co/VOGcbN1e1P

#TeamCisneros is all hands on deck from now through Election Day. Here’s how you can help us GOTV in #CA39:  📞 Call voters 🗣️ Tell friends and family to vote 🗳️ Return your ballot to a drop box 📄 Socially distant contactless lit drop  Sign up below: https://t.co/gMJjCYfrC4

It's a great day to walk around #CA39 for a socially distant contactless flyer drop. Join #TeamCisneros tonight through election day to leave voter information material across the district. You can sign up here: https://t.co/AYVzKwt6YF https://t.co/xx6LavtSGY

What reality is the Trump Administration living in? Maybe the same one in which my opponent hosted a maskless crowded non-socially distant superspreader fundraiser. The pandemic is still here and we can't take our eye off the ball. https://t.co/T8bQT73w1E

It took Senate Republicans 30 days to confirm Justice Amy Coney Barrett. Yet they’ve refused to even consider 2 COVID stimulus packages one that has been sitting in the Senate for 164 days. The American people need relief but Sen. Mitch McConnell doesn’t think it’s a priority.

Sen. Mitch McConnell thinks we shouldn’t pass COVID relief because we’re too close to the election—even though he's rushing to pass a SCOTUS Justice right now.   He's playing political games while families are struggling to put food on the table and keep a roof over their head. https://t.co/AmjggoUAHu

Grateful for everyone who came out to our first socially distant car rally in #CA39 yesterday. Amazing energy! @newman4senate @AndrewForAsm55 @ufcw324  It's all hands on deck for the next 30 days. Help us call voters and stay connected with #TeamCisneros: https://t.co/JKMMQ3HaVt https://t.co/oAVyNiA6Ij

Josh Newman Andrew Rodriguez and I are excited to host a socially distant car rally tomorrow—a first for #CA39. We can't wait to see you there! You can sign up and find details below. 🚙 https://t.co/adIDFgm5Im

Wishing the President and First Lady a full and speedy recovery. I'm praying for them their entire family and all those affected by the coronavirus.  This virus is cruel and relentless. Please wear a mask practice social distancing and wash your hands.

COVID-19 is still affecting our communities and we cannot afford to go backwards. It's on all of us—no matter how old you are—to remain vigilant in stopping the spread of the coronavirus. Wear a mask practice social distancing and wash your hands. https://t.co/x8EJv6NYIZ

Sen. Mitch McConnell is going all out to pass a Supreme Court Justice. If only he could put that same energy and speed in passing COVID relief legislation families and small businesses could get the resources they need.

Hypocrite Sen. Mitch McConnell wants to vote on a SCOTUS Justice within the next 45 days yet he's blocked COVID relief legislation for 127 days. He wants to play political games when families are struggling to pay their rent and put food on the table.

Early in this crisis the President admitted on tape he knew the coronavirus was deadly but chose to downplay it. Nearly 200000 people have died. Workers families & small businesses have suffered.  The President needs to come to the table immediately to pass relief legislation. https://t.co/zt9MtjdxWt
Sen. Mitch McConnell has been blocking coronavirus relief legislation for over 3 months.  The American people need relief now. #HeroesAct https://t.co/WXqwndSlvV

Sen. Mitch McConnell has no problem confirming judges in the Senate but when it comes to bipartisan talks to pass a coronavirus relief package he throws his hands up.  The House passed the #HeroesAct 3 months ago. We’ve been ready to get this done. Let’s go Sen. McConnell. https://t.co/gz8Pr2D6R4

This is alarming—#coronavirus cases are growing in California and across the country.  We all have a part to play to slow the spread of COVID-19. Make sure to: ✅#MaskUp ✅Practice social distancing ✅Practice safe hygiene habits https://t.co/OkmBFEANhe

Just so we’re clear the Administration is holding up the passage of a COVID relief bill because they don’t like the desperately-needed local & state funding. It’s unacceptable.   Our cities counties & states need relief. Public services public safety & jobs are on the line. https://t.co/d5LWbcsgmz

Grateful to join @alexcoheninla on @IssuesOn1 last week to talk about my bipartisan child care bill—which passed the House last Wednesday. It provides the cleaning supplies #PPE & other equipment our child care centers need to keep workers and children safe from #COVID19. #CA39 https://t.co/5igPzgSfVv

Access to testing is key to keeping #CA39 communities safe. If you need a #coronavirus test click ⤵️. Some places require an appointment. Orange County: https://t.co/b0q8A99o9W LA County: https://t.co/ef8BiQ5NKD San Bernardino County: https://t.co/D14y8p8xzD

Without federal assistance 40% of child care centers will close permanently. We need this service especially when parents return to work. I introduced a bipartisan bill to help our child care centers and protect children & child care workers from #COVID. https://t.co/jAPShPq5sl

In the first House Appropriations package I fought for the inclusion of several #CA39 priorities including funding for coronavirus response veterans’ programs and wildfire preparedness. This bill puts the needs of CA-39 residents first. https://t.co/KSzckxRqui

With rising coronavirus cases in California and across the country we all have a responsibility to limit the spread of #COVIDー19. Practice social distancing wear a mask and wash your hands.  https://t.co/KhJNHpns2U

Great news! The #NDAA provisions I championed to combat #COVIDー19 and prepare for future crises passed the full House this week with bipartisan support. Our country needs the resources to fight the coronavirus and support pandemic preparedness efforts. https://t.co/L7ejpeerWw

The health and safety of the American people should be our top priority. That means funding for #coronavirus testing tracing and the CDC. It’s unacceptable that the Trump Administration is trying to block this critical funding as cases continue to rise. https://t.co/H104TAQGH0

This is alarming. Any attempt to manipulate data or hide the truth from the American people would be irresponsible and undermine our ability to effectively fight the coronavirus.  We need full transparency from this Administration. https://t.co/KaLx2EChnP

Long delays supply shortages and a lack of federal coordination are preventing us from getting a handle on the coronavirus.  We need to ensure testing sites have the necessary supplies to conduct tests and provide people with results in a timely manner. https://t.co/aPVyog1pEi

#ICYMI: I championed several provisions to combat COVID-19 and prepare for future pandemics in the unanimous bipartisan NDAA. ✅Create Small Business Industrial Base Resiliency Program ✅Create Pandemic Preparedness and Resilience National Security Fund https://t.co/L7ejpeerWw

Latino and Black Americans are three times as likely to contract the #coronavirus and twice as likely to die from the virus. #COVIDー19 is disproportionately affecting communities of color and we need to do more to eliminate these health disparities. https://t.co/KgovHRpMbg

This week I worked with my Republican & Democratic colleagues to pass the #NDAA out of committee by a unanimous bipartisan vote. I helped secure provisions related to fighting #COVIDー19 preparing for future crises & supporting #CA39 small businesses. https://t.co/x0MuMQetYZ

I’ve heard from #OrangeCounty residents about their challenges in getting a #COVID test. I sent a letter to @ochealth asking for more info on their testing efforts and to increase testing & outreach to the community. We have to close the testing gap. #CA39 https://t.co/9tsiz4DROW

Now more than ever we must remain vigilant in stopping the spread of the #coronavirus.  Follow CDC guidelines practice social distancing wear a mask and practice safe hygiene. #CA39 https://t.co/Ri5ki7IoH3

This is the wrong move. As I’ve said from the beginning we need a coordinated coronavirus response from our federal state and local governments.   Ending federal support for testing sites is irresponsible and reckless. https://t.co/pkC192vAeX

Our cities have been devastated by the coronavirus and budget shortfalls threaten “to worsen municipal services and harm local businesses.”  The #HeroesAct provides $9 billion in direct aid for #CA39 cities and counties. It’s time for the Senate to act. https://t.co/Qoma5FvCeR

More than 120000 Americans have died from the coronavirus and some state are seeing spikes in cases.  The President shouldn’t be slowing down testing we should be ramping it up. https://t.co/amBjuV7TFj

The American people can’t wait till late July for #coronavirus relief. The House already passed the #HeroesAct which includes rent & mortgage relief funding for cities & hospitals and hazard pay for essential workers. The Senate needs to act immediately. https://t.co/nU8pVlOP6P

The lack of transparency is outrageous. 2 weeks ago House Republican leaders defeated a bipartisan PPP transparency bill. Now the Administration is hiding which businesses received taxpayer-backed COVID aid.  The American people deserve to know where their tax dollars are going https://t.co/wKIsuPwnqt

It’s disappointing to see Dr. Quick go. We’re still in a pandemic and we need to listen to our healthcare professionals. Wearing a mask to protect the health and safety of our families and communities should not be a political issue. #coronavirus #CA39 https://t.co/yu1neJTxKB

Throughout the #coronavirus crisis we’ve seen countless #CA39 companies step up to help. Professional Plastics a Fullerton business is making plexiglass for restaurants grocery stores & hospitals in CA-39 & across the U.S. to keep our communities safe. https://t.co/d6syAh1y1h

More than 100000 Americans have died from the coronavirus. 40 million people are unemployed. The American people are demanding justice.   The President just doesn't get it and is making things worse. His complete lack of empathy and leadership are not what our country needs. https://t.co/dOnTqrgdAV

Pulling out from the World Health Organization is a mistake and weakens US global leadership. Information sharing on vaccine development is important to fighting #COVID19. We need to work together on a local and global scale to stop the coronavirus and future pandemics. https://t.co/htuqLdHitK

The American people cannot wait for relief “in the next month or so.” They need action. They deserve action. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell should stop stalling on passing coronavirus relief. https://t.co/hAXnxgXuFC

Cities & counties across the US including #OrangeCounty have been devastated by the #coronavirus. The #HeroesAct provides the relief needed to fund our law enforcement officers firefighters & public services—sanitation education infrastructure. #CA39  https://t.co/oRQe4bNEph

In addition to states our cities and counties are also feeling the strain on their budgets.  Without help from the #HeroesAct cities will have to let first responders go face dramatic cuts in public services and weaken coronavirus response efforts.  We can’t let that happen. https://t.co/dHj2yaEwOS

Tomorrow at 12pm @OCIESBDC and @BuenaParkCA are hosting an informational webinar for their small business emergency grant. Register below.  #BuenaPark small businesses impacted by the #coronavirus with 10 or fewer employees may be eligible to receive a grant of up to $10000. https://t.co/LYJv3tte8R

The removal of Jennifer Santos the lead official for executing the #DefenseProductionAct in the middle of a pandemic is extremely worrying.  Now more than ever we need more PPE #coronavirustests testing supplies and other medical equipment. https://t.co/PMXAVM0QGF

.@homeaidoc’s #EssentialsDiaperDrive2020 started yesterday and they need our help. The coronavirus has increased the demand for baby products including diapers wipes and baby food.   Below are some ways you can assist families with babies and toddlers experiencing homelessness: https://t.co/2J3SNLWRSo
$500 million should be going to nationwide #coronavirus testing small businesses relief and aid for our struggling cities not a vanity project. https://t.co/1Ay4daUARi

Dr. Fauci has been a trusted voice on the coronavirus. The Administration shouldn’t be blocking his House testimony especially since he’s testifying in the Senate.  The American people deserve to hear from him so we can learn how to get out of this crisis & prevent the next one. https://t.co/eW9p1JeKNw
We need more testing. Period.  The #coronavirusrelief bill the House just passed included $25 billion to ramp up testing. It’s a huge step in the right direction. https://t.co/AsbXC9Tfwe

There needs to be more #coronavirus test kits test supplies and testing capabilities.  We have to understand the full scope of our public health crisis in order to move our country forward. https://t.co/DAdP5xZ7Fx

Grateful to sit down with @kevinsxu on @ModelMajorityP earlier this week. We talked about our campaign navigating the #coronavirus and speaking out against anti-Asian racism and discrimination.  You can listen ⬇️ #CA39 https://t.co/n3pEvjkLoH

This is dangerous. Pulling funding from the World Health Organization (WHO) jeopardizes the health of the United States and countries around the world.   During a time when we should be focused on fighting the #coronavirus together isolating ourselves only worsens the problem. https://t.co/jc2V7GUr08
Social distancing works but we can’t put our guard down. We’ve got to keep it going. Please stay at home if you can. #COVID__19 https://t.co/4hm2HP61Fb

Today is #WorldHealthDay. Throughout this #coronavirus crisis our doctors nurses and healthcare workers have demonstrated incredible strength and courage.  Every single day they work around the clock to keep our communities safe. Join me in thanking our heroes. #CA39  👏👏👏 https://t.co/A5VcmusDYJ

It’s alarming that the President has removed the independent Inspector General in charge of overseeing the distribution of the #coronavirus stimulus package.  Our workers small businesses and healthcare workers need to be put first not big corporations. https://t.co/68sMav25fp
.@CDCgov now recommends that you wear a cloth face mask in public to slow the spread of the #coronavirus.   You can make your own from home. Here are some tips from the CDC ⤵️ https://t.co/QewEH3GqNB
We’ve got to keep it up. If you can please stay at home and practice social distancing. It’s on all of us to flatten the #coronavirus curve. #CA39 https://t.co/C0IYpcS7tB

If you have the same questions below or need any more answered make sure you check out this #coronavirus FAQ and resource page: https://t.co/50sHNzVAhf  It’s important you stay informed. #CA39 https://t.co/klVhrn0p2H

#CA39 small businesses please be careful about the information you’re receiving about the #COVID19 Economic Injury Disaster Loans.  And that goes for all the info you’re getting about the #coronavirus. Bad actors are trying to take advantage of this epidemic. https://t.co/5UUsADMZXp
Get the latest news and updates about the #coronavirus in California. It’s critical that you and your loved ones stay informed during this public health crisis. https://t.co/deK46pY6ND

.@MealsOnWheelsOC has done and continues to do amazing work for the #CA39 community and all of Orange County. They’re helping our seniors get the food they need during the #coronavirus crisis.  RT and share so we can get as many eyes on this as possible. https://t.co/Xes89BWFVm

It’s in the toughest of times that we show how strong we are as a community. So many of you have reached out asking how you can help during this public health crisis wondering what actions you can take to aid our community here in #CA39. #coronavirus (1/2)
Gov. @GavinNewsom issued a statewide “stay at home” order. More information below ⤵️  It’s on all of us to slow the spread of the #coronavirus. #CA39 #California https://t.co/50sHNzVAhf

#CA39: Information and resources—in English Spanish Korean and Chinese—about the #coronavirus and how you can protect yourself.  More info ⬇️ English: https://t.co/4RGiPtT55q Spanish: https://t.co/8GA4GQoc5a Korean: https://t.co/aMKRpdFU6x Chinese: https://t.co/EhYg7XiMYo https://t.co/KYB4haqC5d

The President just doesn't learn. This racist & xenophobic language has no place in our society. The CDC Director says it's "absolutely wrong & inappropriate" to call it "Chinese #coronavirus."  We should be standing with our #AAPI Asian American Community not targeting them. https://t.co/WYTGcb5Gay

#OrangeCounty Announcement: "Bans all gatherings closes the county’s bars & breweries and ends dining in at restaurants" following recommendation from the White House to avoid gatherings of 10+ people & echoing Gov. Newsom's guidance. #CA39 #coronavirus https://t.co/nlrJaa8Ttp

The President knows exactly what he’s doing by calling the #coronavirus the “Chinese virus.” The xenophobic racist language is the point. CDC says not to call it that.  #AAPI communities are already facing discrimination & assault.  It’s time to stay focused not inflame stigma. https://t.co/Jr5rLdKYRU

You’ve been hearing a lot about practicing social distancing. This video helps break down what that means ⬇️  It’s on all of us to stop the spread of the #coronavirus. #COVIDー19 https://t.co/L31aLttQIw

#CA39 we all have a part to play in keeping our communities safe and healthy. Protect you and your family from the #coronavirus by washing your hands for at least 20 seconds staying home if you’re sick covering your coughs and sneezes. https://t.co/0txc1dlbR6

Please make sure you're taking the appropriate steps to protect yourself from the #coronavirus: ✅Wash your hands for at least 20 seconds ✅Cover your coughs ✅Stay home if you’re sick ✅Clean & disinfect high-contact surfaces ✅Practice safe health habits https://t.co/FZSvQ0bMLU

These headlines are heartbreaking. This is why our words matter why sharing accurate information about the #coronavirus matters. Nobody should have to deal with this xenophobia and racism. #AAPI  It’s about safety and care. Stay informed and up-to-date➡️https://t.co/dmf2IiHfvt https://t.co/4z9WoYnUYK
#CA39: Here’s how you can plan prepare and keep you and your families safe from the #coronavirus. Stay informed. https://t.co/cS3EQz2ft8

The @GOPLeader is being irresponsible. Associating the #coronavirus with one group of people heightens the racism & xenophobia Chinese American & #AAPI communities have been facing. It doesn't matter if you're a Democrat or Republican we need to call out this abhorrent behavior. https://t.co/G2ssR3FeXG

The President’s denial about the severity of the #coronavirus is reckless and irresponsible. He needs to take this public health crisis seriously & get on the same page with his Administration. The American people deserve truth transparency & leadership. https://t.co/LrvqHv5pJY
